item.title: Cookie Run: Kingdom - How to Get More Topping Pieces
item.description:
Toppings play a big role in helping your Cookies win battles in Cookie Run: Kingdom . Low-level Toppings can weaken your team, lowering your Average Team Power and making fights tougher. Thankfully, these items can be upgraded to make characters stronger and take down every enemy.

Topping Pieces are a special currency required to rank up Toppings in Cookie Run: Kingdom . Like other key items, they’re hard to farm in bulk, but there are definitely many ways to collect them. Here's a rundown on some fast and slow Topping Piece farming methods in Cookie Run: Kingdom .

Best Ways to Farm More Topping Pieces in Cookie Run: Kingdom

Here are the fastest ways to get Topping Pieces in Cookie Run: Kingdom :

Wrap Up Achievements

To farm plenty of Topping Pieces in Cookie Run: Kingdom , players should complete Achievements. These tasks are tied to specific game modes and activities and can be found in the Events section. Here are some of the best ones to try:

Achievements

What to Do

Reward

Tough Cookies

  • Send 5 Balloon Expeditions
  • Attempt upgrading a Topping 10 Times

  • 30 Topping Pieces
  • 30 Topping Pieces

Build Your Castle

  • Upgrade Cookie Castle to Lv. 9

  • 50 Topping Pieces

Cookie of Darkness

Play in the Dark Story Mode and clear:

  • Stage 2-10
  • Stage 4-15
  • Stage 8-21

  • 10 Topping Pieces
  • 10 Topping Pieces
  • 30 Topping Pieces

Tropical Soda Islands

Complete Tropical Soda story stages:

  • 10
  • 22
  • 58
  • 80

  • 30 Topping Pieces (each)

Strawberry Cake Tower

Defeat enemies in the following Strawberry Cake Tower trays:

  • Tray 12
  • Tray 30
  • Tray 55
  • Tray 105

  • 20 Topping Pieces
  • 30 Topping Pieces
  • 50 Topping Pieces
  • 70 Topping Pieces

Trade at Catnip Stores

Another great way to get Topping Pieces is by exchanging Catnip Coins for them in the Catnip Stores. These stalls unlock as you progress through Special Episodes . Just pick one of the Special Episodes' stories, clear its stages, and earn Catnip Coins to access the shop.

Get from Guild Battle's Medal Shop

Players can also grab a bunch of Topping Pieces by purchasing them from the Medal Shop with Heroic Medals . This store is found in the Guild Battle mode, accessible by joining a Guild and interacting with the Statue of Noble Hearts. Just keep defeating bosses to earn Heroic Medals, which can then be spent on Topping Pieces.

Buy from the Event Shops

Cookie Run: Kingdom frequently rolls out events that reward Topping Pieces, such as MyCookie Adventure, Cake Shop, and Shroomie Shenanigans. Keep an eye on the Events section for new events and join in to claim rewards. Some also offer exclusive coins that can be traded for Topping Pieces.

Other Methods to Get Topping Pieces

Additionally, there are many other ways to get Topping Pieces in Cookie Run: Kingdom . While farming through these methods might be time-consuming, it can pay off in the long run. Here’s a breakdown:

  • Complete Crispia World Exploration stages ; each cleared stage gives you a few Topping Pieces.
  • Send out Balloon Dock expeditions , as your Cookies might find some of this currency along the way.
  • Collect Topping Pieces from the Fountain of Abundance ; they appear there every few hours.
  • Lastly, watch ads in your mailbox .

item.title: 7 Open-World Games Where Your Choices Really Matter, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Choices matter and shape the narrative in various ways.
  • Complex dialogue trees and faction choices impact the ending.
  • Some games have time-limited choices impacting the outcome.

One of the greatest things about open-world games is that they offer a ton of possibilities to players, and they can take place in various settings. While some develop in revolutionary war settings, others opt for more peaceful fantasy environments that focus on discovering the world and meeting NPCs.

Some developers even go as far as creating open-world games with no main story, relying instead on polished game mechanics to deliver an entertaining experience to players. In any case, it’s undeniable that this genre is vast and will likely keep rolling out the hits for years to come. Here are some of the best open-world games where choices really matter .

7 Assassin's Creed Odyssey

Consequences Stem From Making Various Choices

  • Choices carry considerable weight
  • A great title that builds on the RPG mechanics implemented in Origins

Assassin's Creed Odyssey is arguably one of the greatest installments in the franchise. While this and other titles in the series pale in comparison to the perfect Ezio Trilogy, Odyssey manages to deliver a wonderful experience to players and keeps building on the RPG system that was implemented in Assassin's Creed Origins .

Throughout the game, players will have to make various decisions that will ultimately impact several aspects of the game. Although there are other titles with more choices and more serious consequences, those present in this title are interesting, to say the least.

6 Dragon Age: Inquisition

Decision Points Matter A Lot

  • Players take on the role of The Inquisitor
  • There's civil unrest in Thedas

Released in 2014, Dragon Age: Inquisition is probably one of the best installments in the series, if not the best. The story focuses on The Inquisitor, who players can control as they journey to settle the civil unrest on the continent of Thedas and close a mysterious tear in the sky known as “The Breach”.

While Dragon Age: Inquisition is already a great game in and of itself, using some of the mods that make the game even better can help further improve the experience players have with it.

5 Cyberpunk 2077

Players Can Determine Various Aspects Of The Game, Including Its Ending

  • Night City is a beautiful setting for the game
  • Choices matter, and they can shape many elements of the story

Few games have managed to portray a futuristic, dystopian society as masterfully as Cyberpunk 2077 . Not only does this title have amazing graphics, outstanding combat mechanics and a lot of things to do, including main and side quests given to players by NPCs, but the narrative is also compelling, and players will be invested in V’s fate in no time.

Those who have already completed the game once might want to check out some of the best ways to make their Cyberpunk 2077 playthrough as hard as possible to up the ante. The choices V makes really matter and can even determine the ending.

4 Fallout 4

Dialogue Trees Are Complex, And Siding With Factions Matters

  • The ending is determined by the faction players ultimately decide to side with
  • The Boston Commonwealth holds many dangers

The Fallout franchise has always been known for having complex dialogue trees that give players tons of options regarding how they want to treat others. Fallout 4 is not the exception, as it lets players choose pathways that involve violence, intimidation, or pacifism.

There are also various factions spread throughout the Boston Commonwealth that players can choose to side with or fight, and this will greatly determine the ending that they get. All the different endings that result from this are interesting, but, naturally, some are more so than others.

3 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Some Choices Are Time-Limited, So Players Must Think Quickly

  • Playing Gwent can be great fun
  • The Continent and The Skellige Isles are very entertaining to explore

Few games have elevated the literary works they're based on as beautifully as The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt . Taking on the role of Geralt of Rivia, players will get to explore the continent and the Skellige Isles to talk to different NPCs, reunite with friends and face off against dangerous mythical creatures, some of which are based on real-life folklore.

Even when they’re not involved in a fight to the death with some monster, players will find there’s no shortage of things to do, and playing Gwent is a great example. Those interested in playing a few matches will want to check out all the Gwent decks in The Witcher 3 to find the right one for them. This title has 36 different endings, and players' choices will greatly determine which one they get.

2 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Players' Choices Shape The Land Of Skyrim In A Few Ways

  • Arguably, the best installment in the franchise
  • Tons of build possibilities

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim completely revolutionized what RPGs set in fantasy open-worlds were at its time and elevated the Elder Scrolls franchise to an even higher position than it already had.

Throughout the game, players’ choices will greatly impact many elements of the land of Skyrim, such as the Jarls that rule in different towns, villages and cities. Another great thing about Skyrim is that it allows for creating various builds that can range from Thief to Battlemage. There are also great weapons to create a Warrior build and decimate enemies with powerful swings of a sword or a greathammer.

1 Red Dead Redemption 2

Arthur's Final Destination Happens Differently Depending On His Honor Level

  • Rockstar Games' Wild West masterpiece
  • Outstanding game mechanics and a perfect narrative

While Grand Theft Auto 5 remains the most popular and profitable title for Rockstar Games, it's undeniable that Red Dead Redemption 2 offers a more compelling narrative and is arguably the developer’s best release so far.

Focusing on Arthur Morgan and the Van der Linde gang, this game will take players on a wonderful journey in the American Wild West in the last years of the 19th century. While there aren't as many choices in Red Dead Redemption 2 as there are in similar titles, Arthur’s Honor level, which is determined by his behavior over time, will define whether his demise is heroic. If players are interested in hunting, they'll find many animals that are very challenging to take down.

item.title: The Best Early-Game Weapons for Yasuke in Assassin's Creed Shadows
item.description:
After playing as Naoe for essentially the entire opening of Assassin's Creed Shadows, you'll unlock Yasuke, gaining access to not only a new character, but an entirely new playstyle. While Naoe fills the role of the typical Assassin's Creed protagonist, playing as Yasuke feels like something new for the series. He is, simply put, not an assassin. Yasuke overwhelms his foes using brute force, and when he is equipped with the right weapons, he is nigh unstoppable. With that in mind, this guide will show you where to find the best early-game weapons for Yasuke, including options for every weapon-type in Assassin's Creed Shadows.

Best Early Game Long Katana For Yasuke – Assassin's Creed Shadows

Turquoise Zephyr:

While Myth Slayer (found below) is technically the better overall weapon, you can find and use Turquoise Zephyr almost as soon as you unlock Yasuke. As a Legendary Long Katana, this weapon will be far superior to any of the lower-rarity swords Yasuke will find, so it is absolutely worth going after this weapon immediately. It will serve to perfectly bridge the gap until you reach level 22, and gain access to Myth Slayer.

Turquoise Zephyr is located in the Eagle's Nest region of Yamashiro , which should be accessible by the time you unlock Yasuke in Assassin's Creed Shadows. The weapon is found in a Legendary Chest that is found in a creek bed crevice, near the Kuji-kiri that sits perfectly between Eagle's Nest and Shoryuji.

Turquoise Zephyr has a powerful Legendary Engraving in its own right, which makes it worth finding even later in the game. The sword's stats are as follows:

  • Legendary Engraving: Successful Parries push nearby enemies back .
  • Key Stat: Adrenaline Gain – This sword boosts Adrenaline gain by increasing amounts as you level it. It does not cause any afflictions.

Myth Slayer:

Without a doubt, Myth Slayer is the best early-game option for Yasuke's main weapon. Not only is it extremely powerful, it also happens to be incredibly cool. Luckily, you don't have to go on any extensive search to find Myth Slayer, but you will likely have to level up a bit before being able to use it.

Myth Slayer's Legendary Engraving is incredibly powerful, with many arguing it's the best in the game. Having the engraving unlocked at the forge makes the collection of this weapon even more worthwhile.

  • Legendary Engraving: Combo Enders are Postured and make enemies Vulnerable.
  • Key Stat: Adrenaline Gain

Best Early Game Secondary Weapons for Yasuke – Assassin's Creed Shadows

Best Early Game Bow for Yasuke – Blush of the Earth Legendary Bow:

Many of the best secondary weapons for Yasuke will come much later in the game, but there are very powerful options when you first unlock Yasuke. Blush of the Earth is one such option, giving Yasuke access to a Legendary Bow as soon as he becomes playable. Blush of the Earth is actually an incredible bow for players who use the Clear Mind skill.

  • Legendary Engraving: Extend Clear Mind duration by 5 seconds

You can get Blush of the Earth by completing the Makino Kurumazuka Kofun in AC Shadows. This underground tomb is a bit tricky to complete, as only Yasuke can perform many of the actions required to get through. The bow is found in the Legendary Chest at the end of the tomb.

It is located in the Yawata Plains section of Izumi Settsu , just east of Takatsuki .

Best Early Game Kanobo for Yasuke – Rage of Red Mist:

The Rage of Red Mist Legendary Kanobo is one of the best in the game, and it can be found as soon as you unlock Yasuke. This Kanobo is great for players who enjoy using abilities, and will continue to be useful long after the early-game sections.

What makes Rage of Red Mist, so great is how fast it will fill adrenaline chunks. Remember too, that even if you find a Kanobo with an engraving that you like more, you can add this weapon's Legendary Engraving once you fully upgrade the forge at AC Shadows' Hideout.

  • Legendary Engraving: 100% of an Adrenaline Chunk on Armor Break

You can find Rage of Red Mist in the Genbu Highlands province of Yamashiro . Head to the Grave of Buried Hopes, then walk out of the southeast corner of the graveyard. You'll find a Legendary Chest in the woods behind a large building.

Best Early Game Teppo for Yasuke – Cascading Fear Legendary Teppo:

While there are a fair amount of lower-rarity Teppos that you can get through quests like the Kabukimono, Cascading Fear is the first Legendary Teppo that Yasuke can easily acquire. Even without the Legendary Engraving, any Legendary weapon simply seems to scale better as you level and upgrade your gear.

  • Legendary Engraving: Kill enemies below 25% Health on headshots.

Cascading Fear is found in the Genbu Highlands province of Yamashiro . You want to head to the southeast corner of the Genbu Highlands, near its border with Kyoto. If you reach the Kinkakuji Temple, you've gone too far. You'll find this weapon in a Legendary Chest at the Namikiri Fudoson Shrine. There is a massive statue at the shrine, and the chest is at the top of the hill directly behind it.

Best Early Game Naginata for Yasuke – Cerulean Nexus Legendary Naginata:

Like the other secondary weapons in this guide, you'll eventually find a much better Naginata later in the game. But if you are looking for the best option directly after unlocking Yasuke, Cerulean Nexus is your best bet.

  • Legendary Engraving: Increased impact on Shoulder Tackle

Cerulean Nexus can be acquired very quickly through the "Projects" section of the Animus. These are structured like "Battle Passes", except they require no actual money. Instead, you must complete the anomalies found around the map. These are very easy missions that reward you with XP and Data Fragments. Cerulean Nexus is only the fourth reward, so you can unlock it very quickly if you try.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows: Best Allies To Upgrade For Naoe
item.description:
One of the major themes of Assassin’s Creed: Shadows is family, especially the value of found family. One way the game ties this theme into its gameplay is with recruitable allies found across Japan, all of which join Naoe and Yasuke’s Kakushiba ikki, their own mini league of assassins.

There are six allies that can be summoned in combat by Naoe, each with their own unique set of active and passive abilities. Players have to choose which to bring carefully, as they can only summon one, and later two, at a time. The best are those which complement Naoe’s strengths and make up for her weaknesses while in battle.

6 Ibuki

A Plain But Effective Swordsman

Of the six possible allies, Ibuki is by far the most boring in terms of abilities, but they are undoubtedly useful. Ibuki is a traditional katana-wielding swordsman and fights in a traditional manner, as well.

His attacks inflict the standard form of damage, impact damage, and the amount of damage per hit is average, as well. His ability to armor break enemies near his summon is helpful on harder difficulties, but not more so than the other allies' abilities. Nonetheless, having an extra attacker and distraction during combat is always useful, even if it isn’t particularly showy.

5 Katsuhime

Fun, Chaotic Melee Combatant

Though Katsuhime is introduced in her story as a ranged specialist, her role in combat is still as a close-quarters attacker. She joins combat with an explosion that inflicts the very useful daze state on enemies, meaning placing her summon is an important part of her effectiveness.

In combat, Katsuhime fires her teppo at close range, though in practice, she mainly spends her time kicking enemies away in order to reload. Her use in combat is comparable to Ibuki, and less than most other allies, but her ricocheting bullets do make fights more visually appealing.

4 Oni-yuri

A Powerful Cloud Of Sleep

Depending on different players’ play styles, the poisoner Oni-yuri could have different uses, but easily her best feature overall is her initial, active ability. She fires a cloud of purple sleep gas in whatever area players choose, with seemingly no limit on how many enemies within that area automatically fall asleep.

If played right, players can run through a horde of enemies, pull them into a group, and by summoning Oni-yuri, instantly put all of them to sleep. From there, it is a simple matter of quickly but carefully, so as not to wake anyone, ground assassinate each enemy, one by one. In that way, Oni-Yuri can turn any location into a series of free kills.

3 Gennojo

A One-Man Utility Belt

Gennojo is the strangest of all of Naoe’s allies, in that his role is completely independent of combat, assuming it works correctly. Calling Gennojo essentially just adds passive improvements to Naoe’s stealth, keeping her from being detected and preventing combat altogether.

Gennojo’s one active ability players can control creates a dazzling projectile to reset enemy alertness. His passive abilities are his real utility, as they prevent enemies from detecting Naoe and prevent servants from alerting enemies of Naoe’s presence. Together, these abilities make Gennojo the best ally for maintaining stealth streaks.

2 Yaya

Endlessly Useful Knockback Power

Yaya is the first ally players will recruit and in many ways, remains the best ally throughout most of the game. She can be summoned in combat to knock down a targeted enemy, and she continues to do so with shoves and kicks throughout her time summoned.

A true one trick pony, Yaya does little damage and nothing besides her knock-down attacks, but that is all she needs to be an excellent ally. Any enemy knocked down is a free ground attack, meaning an almost certain kill. If players use Naoe’s nimbleness correctly, they can spend combat evading until Yaya knocks an enemy down, moving in for a ground strike, and repeating for an easy victory.

1 Yagoro

Overpowered Instant Kills

Yagoro may be the most difficult and time-consuming ally to recruit in Assassin’s Creed Shadows but he is worth it by a mile. His initial ability is to instantly assassinate an enemy with three or fewer health bars. Once upgraded, he can do the same to two enemies of five or fewer health bars each.

For the vast majority of the game, almost every enemy aside from story bosses has five or fewer health bars, meaning Yagoro’s ability is almost always two guaranteed kills, even on samurai, ronin, and large enemies. Combined with an assassination by Naoe, Yagoro can make easy work of three grouped enemies, a long-standing challenge in Assassin’s Creed stealth segments.

item.title: The First Berserker: Khazan - How to Respec
item.description:
The First Berserker: Khazan offers a fresh new take on the tried-and-true soulslike formula. Instead of playing a nameless protagonist, you take on the role of the fallen general Khazan. But similar to other soulslikes, you can build Khazan in different ways by focusing on a variety of stats to create a build that suits your playstyle.

But what if you make a mistake while upgrading your character? Thankfully, the game offers a simple respec system that lets you reset your stat points and rebuild from scratch. You can also reset your weapon skills if you want to switch to a different weapon archetype. In this guide, we'll break down how the respec mechanics work in The First Berserker: Khazan so you can experiment with different builds as much as you like.

How to Respec Your Stats in The First Berserker: Khazan

Resetting your stats in The First Berserker: Khazan requires a special consumable called the Primeval Regression Orb. Using one from your inventory will reset Khazan's stats back to default and return all the Lacrima you've spent. Afterward, you can interact with a Blade Nexus and reassign your stats from scratch to try a completely different build.

If you get killed right after using the Primeval Regression Orb, you'll drop all your Lacrima at the spot where you died. So make sure you're in a safe zone when using it.

How to Get Primeval Regression Orbs

Primeval Regression Orbs are a rare and valuable resource, especially early in the game. You can find some while exploring the map. In Embars Ruins, you'll encounter a traveling merchant NPC known as the Bard , located near the Forgotten Temple Entrance Blade Nexus. He has 3 Primeval Regression Orbs in his inventory, each costing 10,000 Gold, which is a significant investment in the early game.

To find the Bard in Embars Ruins, enter the Forgotten Temple from the Blade Nexus and head up the large stairs on the right side. You'll hear music playing from above; this is your cue. Walk up the stairs, turn right, open the gate, and drop down to the lower platform to find him.

Later in the game, you can find Bard in the following locations, and you can purchase 3 Primeval Regression Orbs each time:

  • Skoffa Cave
  • Rephalan Mountains
  • Rovelion Imperial Theater
  • Capital City Vitalon

You'll always hear this NPC playing music when he's nearby.

In the later stages, you'll be able to craft Primeval Regression Orbs through the Blacksmith in The Crevice, but only after completing the Daphorna's Codex challenge to get the Tome of Regression material. Afterward, you can craft the Primeval Regression Orb from the Blacksmith by spending:

  • x2 Transmutation Mist
  • x10 Transmutation Shard
  • x2,000 Gold

How to Respec Weapon Skills in The First Berserker: Khazan

Resetting your weapon skills is much simpler than respeccing your stats. To do it, open the Weapon Skills menu from the in-game menu. Here, you can reset individual skills by selecting them and pressing Y/Triangle on the controller, or R on the PC to regain the spent Skill Point. You can then reassign the point to any other unlocked skill. Alternatively, you can reset all skills at once by holding L3/LS on controllers or CTRL on PC. This gives you a blank slate to rebuild your weapon skill tree however you like.

The First Berserker: Khazan gives you the flexibility to adapt and experiment without being locked into a single playstyle. Just make sure you don't lose all your Lacrima after using a Primeval Regression Orb. To stay safe, it’s best to handle all your stat resets at The Crevice, where you won’t risk facing any enemy. Then you can simply fast travel to whichever Blade Nexus you need to get to, and continue with your journey.
